Anatomy: Duodenal atresia

The double bubble sign on X-ray is characteristic of duodenal atresia. The "bubbles" represent the dilated stomach and proximal duodenum, which are obstructed. Bilious vomiting occurs because the obstruction is distal to the ampulla of Vater, where bile enters the duodenum. Abdominal distension is due to the accumulation of gas and fluid in the dilated stomach and duodenum.
Final Answer: Duodenal atresia
